title: Yorick song/poem
body:
I originally posted this on NA Board as a comment but since I am so darn proud of it I thought that I have to duplicate it on OCE forum too, well to show off my work (pls no hate).

**So here we go**

I dig, I dig and I dig,
The ancestors serve as my bid.
The dead end of hungering famine,
There is a quota that I have to meet.

I take, I take and I take,
For reasons of what I can not say.
The lifeless wind and the smell of death,
Red mountains and the tainted lake.

I find, I find and I find,
Tears fall across the sea of fireflies,
And the graveyard of pestilence left behind,
I wonder again about resting, what is it like?

I long, I long and I long,
For a shard of light that fall,
From behind the the fog of war.
Like a husk protecting, an empty soul.

replies.body: That's terrible, Justin Biebers songs are better than this.

I am relieved, JB taught me to never say NEVER! He is my idol!!

Which I just did not once but twice.
